A bit about me

I’m Cátia Neto, but friends call me Cates.

I’m a multidiciplinary designer with special focus on creating meaningful brands, and craft the brand experience throughtout multiple touchpoints. I started working as a graphics designer in 2010, after getting my BA in Communication Design. After a couple of years working mainly for events and exhibitions, I began focusing my work on branding and visual identity, an area that has been core for the past six years.

Over the last year I've been taking the first steps working as a UI/UX designer, bringing all the knowledge and experience in visual design as well as consistent and meaningful brand communication to every project I work on.

Skills & Education

Skills

  • Branding and visual identity

  • UX/UI design

  • Graphic and editorial design

Software

  • Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, and Photoshop

Languages

Postgraduation

Digital Experience Design

2021–2022

Faculty of Fine Arts, University of Lisbon

This postgraduation course is specialised in digital experience design. The curriculum focuses on user centred design and research, interaction design, user interface design, front‑end development, digital marketing, and design strategy.

Bachelor's Degree

Communication Design

2006–2010

Faculty of Fine Arts, University of Lisbon

The BA course focused on graphic design providing a strong conceptual and cultural context in which to develop the core skills of a designer. The course provided special attention to editorial and information design, typography, photography, audiovisual outputs, and webdesign.
